All templates excluding CentOS 5.5 utilize pygrub. All CentOS 5.5 templates use the default kernel.
PyGrub enables you to start Linux DomUs with the kernels that lie in the filesystem of the DomU instead of with a Kernel that lies in the filesystem of the Dom0. For more information on pygrub visit: http://wiki.xen.org/xenwiki/PyGrub
If you don't see the template you want. Ask. We may be able to make it for you.

Flexible Terms:
No contracts. No setup fees. Monthly billing, cancel at anytime. 7 Day money back guarantee.

Is any support included with my Xen VPS?
Yes, hardware and network support is included. All Xen vps are 100% self managed by the client.

Is your setup really instant?
All VPS orders are setup by SolusVM instantly upon payment receipt. With VPS Unlimited you do not need to wait for human intervention to start using the services you paid for!
*Please allow up to 15 minutes from confirmed payment for your VPS to come online.

Can I cancel at any time?
You are allowed to cancel at anytime. We just ask that you cancel three days before your billing date.

Do you offer a money back guarantee?
VPS Unlimited offers you a risk free money back guarantee. At any time in the first 7 days after ordering your first VPS from us, simply log into your client area and submit a support ticket asking for a refund and you should receive it within 48 hours. Excludes custom orders, additional IPs and control panels.

Can I use this VPS for a VPN? Is tun/tap enabled?
The answer to both questions is Yes. A VPS with VPS Unlimited would be perfect for a VPN. Since we offer Xen, tun/tap acts as it would if this were a dedicated server. You do not need to submit a support ticket asking for us to enable tun/tap, (this would be done at other companies offering OpenVZ). Tun/tap is ommited from some of our minimal install templates (including CentOS 5.5) and because of this we recommend choosing a template that already has /dev/net/tun configured for you, such as CentOS 5.6 (both 32 & 64).

To check if your VPS is ready to install your VPN client and has tun/tap properly configured run this command: cat /dev/net/tun

If you get this result Tun/Tap is ready for your VPN Software to be installed:
File descriptor in bad state

If you get this error then Tun/Tap is not ready for your VPN Software and you should switch to a newer template that has tun/tap pre-configured (CentOS 5.6):
No such device
